sentences.english: Let’s say you want to make an extra $200 a month.
sentences.chinese: 再打个比方吧，你想每月多挣个200美刀。

sentences.english: We have 800-ton heat treatment capability per month.
sentences.chinese: 生产手段齐全能量大，生产能力每月可达800吨。

sentences.english: This product sells well, there are no goods remaining every month.
sentences.chinese: 这种产品销路顺畅，基本上每月都是满产满销。

sentences.english: Some agents have 20-30 employees on a monthly payroll, he said.
sentences.chinese: 一些代理每月会有20至30民雇员，他补充道。

sentences.english: I would like to receive from you a detailed report on current market conditions every month .
sentences.chinese: 我想每月收到你方一份具体确当前市场行情报告。

sentences.english: This yields NT$18,000 or so of disposable income for each person in the household every month.
sentences.chinese: 得出家中每人每月可支配所得是一万八千多元。

sentences.english: A small or medium web site will consume between 1GB and 5GB of data transfer per month.
sentences.chinese: 一个小型或中等网站每月会有1到5GB的数据转换。

sentences.english: It can be used for at least Five years, and monthly clean and 20min sun can prolong its life.
sentences.chinese: 使用期五年，每月清洗晾晒20分钟可延长使用寿命。

sentences.english: The armed forces are so under-financed that aircraft crashes have become a monthly occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 武装部队资金严重不足，坠机事件已经每月出现一起。

sentences.english: I request for statement by post. HK$20/month will be charged.
sentences.chinese: 本人要求邮寄月结单，每月手续费为$20。

sentences.english: This type of policy will have a higher monthly premium as well as deductibles .
sentences.chinese: 这种政策就会有较高的每月保费以及免赔额。

sentences.english: The charge of water is settled and paid to the actual usage each month.
sentences.chinese: 乙方使用的自来水费按实结算，每月支付甲方。

sentences.english: He's getting barraged with new scripts every month from filmmakers across Asia.
sentences.chinese: 他每月都会接二连三地接到来自亚洲制片人的新剧本。

sentences.english: he pays, I think, about two thousand dollars a month.
He spends nearly one third of his monthly income （in） buying books.
sentences.chinese: 他把每月收入的三分之一用来买书。

definition: expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
to give an extra subsidy, or bonus etc/bonus/perquisite
rent for a room or house
